articles.title: Die älteste Sprache Europas und das Wort „glücklich“
articles.image_title: This handout image, released by the Government of Navarra on November 14, 2022, shows The Hand of Irulegi, an archaeological discovery found at the Irulegui archaeological site in Laquidain, close to Pamplona. - The bronze hand from more than 2,000 years ago found at the archaeological site of Irulegui, southeast of Pamplona, bears the oldest known text in Basque and was made to be placed on homes' doors to protect them from misfortune. It shows five words, the first of which has been identified as "sorioneku", similar to "zorioneko" in modern Basque, which means "of good fortune, of good omen" (Photo by Handout / NAVARRA GOVERNMENT / AFP) / RESTRICTED TO EDITORIAL USE - MANDATORY CREDIT "AFP PHOTO / GOVERNMENT OF NAVARRA" - NO MARKETING NO ADVERTISING CAMPAIGNS - DISTRIBUTED AS A SERVICE TO CLIENTS

articles.title: Kiew kündigt Befreiung weiterer Gebiete an
articles.image_title: November 9, 2022, Mykolaiv, Ukraine: Ukrainian soldiers from the 63 brigade were seen in sniper position as part of a military training simulating an attack in the trenches for the counteroffensive to recapture Kherson. The training which involves 31 soldiers aims to improve combat skills in the battlefield. Russia's military has been ordered to withdraw from the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson, pulling out from the western bank of the Dnipro River entirely. It marks significance as the regional capital has been captured since the invasion in February. (Credit Image: © Ashley Chan/SOPA Images via ZUMA Press Wire

articles.image_title: ARCHIV - 07.01.2022, Indien, Mumbai: Personen gehen über einen gut besuchten Markt in Mumbai. Ob die Weltbevölkerung tatsächlich genau am 15. November die Acht-Milliarden-Marke knackt, ist doch sehr fraglich. Da es aber unmöglich ist, den Überblick über Hunderttausende Geburten und Todesfälle pro Tag zu behalten, haben die Vereinten Nationen den Dienstag Mitte des Monats für den großen Menschheits-Meilenstein ausgewählt. (zu dpa "Menschheits-Meilenstein acht Milliarden - ein Grund zum Feiern?") Foto: Rajanish Kakade/AP/dpa +++ dpa-Bildfunk +++
